title: Disconnects in the LoL Client
body:
TL;DR - We have [a short-term work around](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#wq11) for the client disconnects, but are still looking for a permanent solution.

Hey Summoners,

For the last few days, we’ve heard a lot of your reports about disconnecting from the LoL Client. Some of you might have seen this through the ticker, where you suddenly get a message saying “Disconnected from PvP.net.” Or possibly when you’re on your way into a game, and you’re disconnected from Champ Select and have close down and relog, potentially ruining a promotion series. It’s a frustrating experience that we’re working to resolve. To be clear on one thing, these disconnects don’t seem to occur in-game.

We don’t have an answer for you yet, but we’ll update this thread when we have new information. One working theory is that our client behaves oddly with [Window’s IP Helper ](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa366073(v=vs.85).aspx)(or vice versa), but we’re not sold on that theory yet. We’re combing through recent changes to both LoL and Windows to look for other more likely suspects.

While we’re investigating the root cause of the issues, we’ve seen players have some luck solving the problem themselves. We’ve documented this work around, and wanted to share it to relieve you all of some pain while we find a long-term fix. 

Here are the instructions: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#wq11

Thank you for your patience, everyone.
RBS

Hey Summoners,

Here's our second update:

After looking into the issue further, we realized that the disconnects stem from interactions between Adobe's AIR Client technology and Microsoft's IP routing technology.

We're talking with both companies right now to figure out how we can solve the issue for you.

For the time being, please continue to use our temporary work-around to avoid the issue, documented here: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664#wq11

Again, thank you for your patience.
RBS

Hey everyone,

Update for today: 
We're working to find a consistent reproduction of the issue. Unfortunately, and surprisingly, that's been a challenge. 

We've also reached Adobe and they have kindly agreed to help us resolve the issue. They're sending us a version of the AIR Client with a potential fix for the issue, and we'll use that to test once we have a consistent repro. 

Once again, thanks for your patience.
